chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolas J Poplawski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 21, 2017 at 11:30 am.

All bonds (17CF142,17CF170,17CF178,17CF193) modified to include:
One day furlough either next Tuesday 08/15/17 or Thursday 08/17/17 to allow the defendant to go with mother Kelly Robbins to Winnebago Co DHHS for evaluation of inpatient treatment program.
Defendant to return immediately after evaluation - All other conditions remain the same:
The Court amends the cash bond (covering 17 CF 142, 17 CF 170 and 17 CF 178 and 17 CF 193) to a $5,000.00 signature bond on the condition that def. provide proof of Nova inpatient treatment program.
Additional conditions include booking, not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961, comply with the terms of the Nova treatment facility, not terminate his treatment and/or leave the treatment facility w/o written authorization by the facility.
Upon completion of the Nova treatment program, def. to enroll in all appropriate aftercare - also needs to provide to DA's office all compliance w/after care program.
If no proof is submitted by the def., cash bonds to be re-instated immediately.
The cash bonds remain in effect until his Nova treatment bed is available - def. to take the most direct route to the treatment facility.

The Court amends the cash bond (covering 17 CF 142, 17 CF 170 and 17 CF 178 and 17 CF 193) to a $5,000.00 signature bond on the condition that def. provide proof of Nova inpatient treatment program.
Additional conditions include booking, not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961, comply with the terms of the Nova treatment facility, not terminate his treatment and/or leave the treatment facility w/o written authorization by the facility.
Upon completion of the Nova treatment program, def. to enroll in all appropriate aftercare - also needs to provide to DA's office all compliance w/after care program.
If no proof is submitted by the def., cash bonds to be re-instated immediately.
The cash bonds remain in effect until his Nova treatment bed is available - def. to take the most direct route to the treatment facility.
